instructions.title: How To Deactivate Your Slack Account
instructions.before: You can only Delete or Deactivate your Slack Account on a Computer, you cannot do so on a mobile device.  Only a workspace Primary Owner can Delete a Slack Workspace. If you are not the primary owner you can Deactivate your Workspace which is the same as deleting since it will now be removed.
instructions.after: Your account will be deactivated after confirm your deactivation request.

qnAnswers.question: What happens when I Deactivate or Delete My Slack Account?
qnAnswers.answer: Deactivating your account won't delete messages or files you've shared. It is recommended that you delete content you'd like to remove before deactivating your account.

qnAnswers.question: Can Reactivate a Deleted or Deactivated Workspace?
qnAnswers.answer: No. Deleting a Slack workspace cannot be undone: once you delete a workspace, all of its messages and files will be irretrievable, so it is recommended that you download a copy of your data first.  You can, however, sign up again with the same email address.  [Click here for more on exporting data] (https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/201658943-Export-your-workspace-data).

qnAnswers.question: If I am not the Primary owner of a Workspace can I Delete my Account?
qnAnswers.answer: No, but you can deactivate it. Deactivation is the same as deletion essentially.  For deactivation you are deleting your account that is tied to the workspace, not the whole workspace.

qnAnswers.question: Does Deactivating my Slack Account Delete every Workspace?
qnAnswers.answer: No. For every workspace you've joined, you'll need to deactivate each account individually.

qnAnswers.question: Can I Transfer Ownership of my Workspace instead of Deleting My Account?
qnAnswers.answer: Yes.  Once you transfer ownership you will be an account holder.  As an account holder you have the option of deactivating your account.

steps: [Go to the Slack Sign in] (https://slack.com/signin) If you’re already logging in, doing so will open your Slack Workspace.
Click the Settings Gear on the Right Side
Scroll Down and Click Deactivate My Account
Check the Box and Click Yes Deactivate My Account

instructions.title: How to Delete Your Slack Account
instructions.before: You can only Delete or Deactivate your Slack Account through an Internet Browser, you cannot do so through the App on a Mobile Device.  Only a workspace Primary Owner can Delete a Slack Workspace. If you are not the primary owner you can Deactivate your Workspace which is the same as deleting since it will now be removed.
instructions.after: Your account will be deleted after confirm your deletion request.

qnAnswers.question: What happens when I Deactivate or Delete My Slack Account?
qnAnswers.answer: Deactivating your account won't delete messages or files you've shared. It  is recommended that you delete content you'd like to remove before deactivating your account.

qnAnswers.question: Can Reactivate a Deleted or Deactivated Workspace?
qnAnswers.answer: No. Deleting a Slack workspace cannot be undone: once you delete a workspace, all of its messages and files will be irretrievable, so it is recommended that you download a copy of your data first. You can, however, sign up again with the same email address. [Click here for more on exporting data] (https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/201658943-Export-your-workspace-data).

qnAnswers.question: If I am not the Primary owner of a Workspace can I Delete my Account?
qnAnswers.answer: No, but you can deactivate it. Deactivation is the same as deletion essentially.  For deactivation you are deleting your account that is tied to the workspace, not the whole workspace.

qnAnswers.question: Can I Transfer Ownership of my Workspace instead of Deleting My Account?
qnAnswers.answer: Yes.  Once you transfer ownership you will be an account holder.  As an account holder you have the option of deactivating your account.

qnAnswers.question: Does Deactivating my Slack Account Delete every Workspace?
qnAnswers.answer: No. For every workspace you've joined, you'll need to deactivate each account individually.

steps: [Go to the Slack Website] (https://www.slack.com). If you're already logged in, doing so will open your Slack home page
Click your Workspace Name on the Top Left
Select Profile and Account from the Menu
Click the Gear Icon on the Right Side
Scroll Down and Click Delete Workspace
Check Confirm Deletion and then Click Yes, Delete My Workspace
